newsitem.title: CHINA: China claims victory over EU cloth dumping charges.
newsitem.headline: China claims victory over EU cloth dumping charges.

text.p: The abandonment last month of European Union plans to impose anti-dumping charges on Chinese unbleached cotton imports was a victory for Beijing over protectionism, the China Daily Business Weekly said on Sunday.
The EU in May buried its plans to slap 18.9 percent duties on Chinese-origin imports of unbleached cotton imports and said duties already paid would be returned.
The decision showed China had scored a victory over European trade protectionism, the China Daily Business Weekly quoted textiles expert Yu Boge as saying.

The investigation into China's unbleached cotton imports was the most prominent demonstration of European protectionism and was politically tainted, the newspaper quoted Shi Zhaoyu of the Ministry of Foreign Trade and Economic Cooperation as saying.
Provisional anti-dumping duties levied on China had pushed total tariffs up to 30.9 percent, crippling Chinese unbleached cotton exports, the newspaper said.
The move had been unjustifiable, since Chinese exports had not harmed the European textile industry, which was most threatened by exports from the former Soviet Union, it said.
